intro: Ricinocarpus angolensis, commonly known as the African butter tree, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, palm-like leaves and yellow-orange flowers. The plant produces a unique type of fruit known as a syncarp, which contains a single large seed surrounded by a fleshy, edible pulp. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat. The plant has traditional uses in local communities for food and medicinal purposes.
